analyzed: bdag gi lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nongs ba cung zad ci bgyis pa //

translated: May I always see the inconceivable beings dwelling in front of me.

analyzed: bdag gi bsod nams cung zad ci mchis deng de byang chub bsngo bar bgyi //

analyzed: sems can ched du spyod pa kun dang sdug bsngal thams cad spro bar bgyi //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, I rejoice in all their practices and in all their sufferings.

analyzed: sems can thams cad byang chub mchog gi lam du rab tu gzung bar bgyi //

analyzed: smra ba'i sengge nges par mngon par shes pa lnga rnams thob par shog /

analyzed: 'dren pa chags med ye shes ldan zhing thams cad gzigs pa lung bstan gsol //

analyzed: 'jig rten du yang sangs rgyas chos kun kha lo sgyur bar 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: me tog sil ma gtor ba nam mkha' la ni gdugs su gnas par shog /

analyzed: lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin mi rnams lhag pa kun kyang dbang gyis shig /

analyzed: sa rnams g-yo bar byed cing khyod kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal shog /

original: sa steng nga la lhas byin gyis ni @363b rdo ba 'phangs pa dang // kye ma ngas ni zla ba gsum du rta chas zos pa dang // phyar ka gtang phyir bu mo mdzes ldan rab tu gang btang dang // me mdag 'bar ba mi bzad pas ni 'obs rnams bkang ba dang //
analyzed: sa steng nga la lhas byin gyis ni @363b rdo ba 'phangs pa dang // kye ma ngas ni zla ba gsum du rta chas zos pa dang // phyar ka gtang phyir bu mo mdzes ldan rab tu gang btang dang // me mdag 'bar ba mi bzad pas ni 'obs rnams bkang ba dang //
translated: And the ditches were filled with unbearable, blazing embers,

analyzed: kha zas dag ni myur du gdug pa'i dug dang sbyar ba yi //
translated: And the food was quickly mixed with poison.

original: de la sdig pa'i las can khyod ni rtsa bar nges pa yin //
analyzed: de la sdig pa'i las can khyod ni rtsa bar nges pa yin //
translated: “You are the one who is certainly the worst criminal here.

original: khyod nyid dpung bcas bu dang lhan cig sder bcas 'ongs nas su //
analyzed: khyod nyid dpung bcas bu dang lhan cig sder bcas 'ongs nas su //
translated: You have come with your army, your sons, and your retinue,

original: nga gsad phyir ni mda' bo che dang ral gri mda' mang thogs //
analyzed: nga gsad phyir ni mda' bo che dang ral gri mda' mang thogs //
translated: To kill me, armed with your great arrows, swords, and many arrows.

original: 'on kyang 'dir ni khyod kyis nga yi spu gcig ma g-yos na //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir ni khyod kyis nga yi spu gcig ma g-yos na //
translated: But you have not moved a single hair of mine here.

original: ci phyir khyod ni rgyags par gyur nas da dung 'dug /
analyzed: ci phyir khyod ni rgyags par gyur nas da dung 'dug /
translated: Why do you remain here, puffed up with pride?

original: ji snyed bdud ni stong phrag bye ba rgol du yang btsud kyang //
analyzed: ji snyed bdud ni stong phrag bye ba rgol du yang btsud kyang //
translated: “As many as ten billion māras have been brought to fight,

original: sems can bye ba khrag khrig dag ni 'dir yang lhags nas su //
analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig dag ni 'dir yang lhags nas su //
translated: And here ten trillion sentient beings have gathered.

original: zhing kun rab tu gang bar 'dug pa nga yi dbang yin te //
analyzed: zhing kun rab tu gang bar 'dug pa nga yi dbang yin te //
translated: They are all filled with my power and sit in all the fields.

original: nga ni khyod phyir mchog tu byams pa'i yid kyis gnas par bya //
analyzed: nga ni khyod phyir mchog tu byams pa'i yid kyis gnas par bya //
translated: I remain here with a mind of supreme love for you.

original: nga ni snying rje'i gnas te 'gro ba rjes su 'dzin byed pa //
analyzed: nga ni snying rje'i gnas te 'gro ba rjes su 'dzin byed pa //
translated: “I am the abode of compassion, the one who cares for the world.

original: khyod ni shin tu gtum po nga la rtag tu bgegs byed de //
analyzed: khyod ni shin tu gtum po nga la rtag tu bgegs byed de //
translated: You are a very violent one who always creates obstacles for me.

original: thub pa'i dbang po khyu mchog 'di dag nga yi dbang yin da ltar tha ma'i dus la nga ni sangs rgyas mdzad pa bya //
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang po khyu mchog 'di dag nga yi dbang yin da ltar tha ma'i dus la nga ni sangs rgyas mdzad pa bya //
translated: “These lords of sages, these bulls, are my disciples. Now, in the final period, I will perform the deeds of a buddha.

original: rnam thar sems kyis sems can rnams kyi don yang spyad par bya //
analyzed: rnam thar sems kyis sems can rnams kyi don yang spyad par bya //
translated: I will practice for the sake of sentient beings with a liberated mind.

original: smras par gyur kyang bzod pa yongs su btang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: smras par gyur kyang bzod pa yongs su btang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Even if I am reviled, I will not give up on patience.

original: nga la phrag dog byed ba rab tu khro ba'i yid med de //
analyzed: nga la phrag dog byed ba rab tu khro ba'i yid med de //
translated: I do not have a jealous mind that is very angry.

original: khyed ni rjes su gzung phyir nga nyid rtag tu mngon par brtson //🔽nga la gsol dang khyod yid zhi phyir 'jig rten gsum dag tu //🔽mchog tu zhi bar byed pa'i chos kyi bdud @364a *//
analyzed: khyed ni rjes su gzung phyir nga nyid rtag tu mngon par brtson // nga la gsol dang khyod yid zhi phyir 'jig rten gsum dag tu // mchog tu zhi bar byed pa'i chos kyi bdud @364a *//
translated: I am always striving for the sake of those to be guided.🔽Ask me, and I will explain the nectar-like Dharma

original: rtsi bshad par bya //
analyzed: rtsi bshad par bya //
translated: that brings supreme peace in the three worlds for the sake of your peace of mind.

original: de phyir khyod kyi sdig pa'i las rnams med par rab 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: de phyir khyod kyi sdig pa'i las rnams med par rab 'gyur gyi //

original: 'jig rten mgon po nga la yid ni myur du dad par byos //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po nga la yid ni myur du dad par byos //
translated: Quickly generate faith in me, the protector of the world.

original: khyod ni rtag tu 'di na gnod pa bya bar rab sems kyang //
analyzed: khyod ni rtag tu 'di na gnod pa bya bar rab sems kyang //
translated: Even though you always think of doing harm to me,

original: khyod dgrol phyir ni nga snying rtag tu byams par rab tu dang // sdig pa'i blo gros por la dad bcas yid la byos shig dang // ring por mi thogs khyod ni byang chub tu yang lung bstan to //
analyzed: khyod dgrol phyir ni nga snying rtag tu byams par rab tu dang // sdig pa'i blo gros por la dad bcas yid la byos shig dang // ring por mi thogs khyod ni byang chub tu yang lung bstan to //
translated: Abandon your evil thoughts and be faithful, and you will soon be predicted to awakening.

original: de nas bdud sdig can bcom ldan 'das la rab tu khros te 'khrugs shing rngam nas de nas slar 'gro bar 'dod pa dang / bdag gi mgul pa bcing ba lngas bcings pa snyam du shes te /
analyzed: de nas bdud sdig can bcom ldan 'das la rab tu khros te 'khrugs shing rngam nas de nas slar 'gro bar 'dod pa dang / bdag gi mgul pa bcing ba lngas bcings pa snyam du shes te /
translated: Then Māra, the evil one, became very angry with the Blessed One, agitated, and furious. He wanted to leave, but he thought, “My neck is bound with five bonds.”

original: 'jigs skrag pa'i sgra dbyung bar 'dod kyang de ma nus nas bcom ldan 'das bgrongs pa'i phyir rang khros pa'i mthus shin tu tsha ba'i dbugs btang ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dbugs de shin tu yid du 'ong ba'i me tog tu mngon par sprul to //
analyzed: 'jigs skrag pa'i sgra dbyung bar 'dod kyang de ma nus nas bcom ldan 'das bgrongs pa'i phyir rang khros pa'i mthus shin tu tsha ba'i dbugs btang ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dbugs de shin tu yid du 'ong ba'i me tog tu mngon par sprul to //
translated: He wanted to make a fearful sound, but he was unable to. Then, out of his own anger, he exhaled a very hot breath in order to kill the Blessed One, but the Blessed One transformed that breath into very pleasant flowers.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing 'tsho la gzhes te chos kyang ston pa de thams cad kyi dbu'i gtsug gi drang thad kyi steng gi bar snang la shin tu yid du 'ong ba'i gdugs su byin gyis brlabs so🔽// sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag 'khod pa de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la gsol pa /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing 'tsho la gzhes te chos kyang ston pa de thams cad kyi dbu'i gtsug gi drang thad kyi steng gi bar snang la shin tu yid du 'ong ba'i gdugs su byin gyis brlabs so // sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag 'khod pa de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la gsol pa /
translated: He consecrated a parasol that was extremely pleasing to the mind, which appeared in the sky above the crowns of the heads of all the bhagavān buddhas who were present, living, and remaining in the world systems in the ten directions, and who were teaching the Dharma.

original: me tog gi gdugs 'di dag ga las mchis /
analyzed: me tog gi gdugs 'di dag ga las mchis /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who were present in those buddha realms asked those bhagavān buddhas, “Bhagavān, where have these flower parasols come from?

analyzed: @364b su'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lags / bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Whose miraculous power has created them?”

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Those bhagavān buddhas said to those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, “Noble sons,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de /
translated: there is a world system called Sahā.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba de rab tu nyon mongs pa can snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sngon gyi smon lam gyis bla na med pa yang dag
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba de rab tu nyon mongs pa can snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sngon gyi smon lam gyis bla na med pa yang dag
translated: There is the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Śākyamuni, who, by his previous aspirations, has appeared in a buddha realm with five degenerations and great afflictions to🔽

analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos ston te /
translated: There, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Śākyamuni, due to his previous aspirations, has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in a buddha realm that is afflicted and endowed with the five degenerations and teaches the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de da ltar bdud kyi yul gyi stobs thams cad rab tu 'joms par byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de da ltar bdud kyi yul gyi stobs thams cad rab tu 'joms par byed pa /

analyzed: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad mthon por byed pa /

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i rgyud thams cad dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi sgron ma yun ring du gnas par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rnam par 'phel ba'i brtson 'grus kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs byed pa /

translated: and through the power of the blessings of diligence that cause the continuity of the Buddha’s teachings and the lamp of the Three Jewels to remain for a long time and all roots of virtue to increase,

analyzed: dgra dang phas kyis rgol ba thams cad shin tu tshar gcod par byed pa /

original: ngo mi mtshar dang / bkra mi shis pa dang / rtsod pa dang / rmi lam ngan pa dang / ltas ngan pa dang / mu ge dang / 'jigs pa'i tshogs dang / 'thab pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / 'ching ba dang / 'thab mo dang /
analyzed: ngo mi mtshar dang / bkra mi shis pa dang / rtsod pa dang / rmi lam ngan pa dang / ltas ngan pa dang / mu ge dang / 'jigs pa'i tshogs dang / 'thab pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / 'ching ba dang / 'thab mo dang /
translated: It pacifies all that is inauspicious, quarrels, bad dreams, bad omens, famines, dangers, disputes, conflicts, bonds, fights,

analyzed: rtsod pa dang / char mi 'bab pa dang / dus ma yin par gang zhing tsha ba dang / rlung dang / tsho ba dang / nad dang / sgra mi snyan pa thams cad @365a *//
translated: disputes, droughts, untimely floods and heat waves, winds, frosts, diseases, and unpleasant sounds.

original: rab tu zhi bar byed pa /
analyzed: rab tu zhi bar byed pa /

analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa thams cad 'dun par byed pa /

analyzed: rgyal rigs thams cad 'dun par byed cing 'gugs pa /

original: rigs bzhi thams cad chos kyi don la 'dzud pa /
analyzed: rigs bzhi thams cad chos kyi don la 'dzud pa /

original: shes rab kyi sgron ma rab tu 'bar bar byed pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi sgron ma rab tu 'bar bar byed pa /
translated: It blazes with the lamp of wisdom.

original: lam drang po rab tu ston pa /
analyzed: lam drang po rab tu ston pa /
translated: It shows the straight path.

original: khyim dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / pho brang 'khor dang / yul 'khor thams cad 'dun par byed pa /
analyzed: khyim dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / pho brang 'khor dang / yul 'khor thams cad 'dun par byed pa /
translated: He is the one who brings together all the houses, villages, towns, cities, countries, regions, kingdoms, and royal courts.

analyzed: lo tog dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / 'bru dang / sman thams cad grub par byed pa /
translated: He is the one who brings together all the harvests, flowers, fruits, grains, and herbs.

analyzed: bzo dang / las kyi mtha' dang / gnas dang / byin gyis brlabs dang / dgos pa thams cad grub par byed pa /
translated: He is the one who brings together all the arts, crafts, abodes, blessings, and necessities.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi nyes pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi nyes pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa /
translated: He is the one who pacifies all the faults of body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: rig pa dang / dran pa dang / blo gros dang / mos pa dang / dpa' ba dang / brtan pa dang / bzod pa dang / spobs pa rnam par 'phel bar byed pa /
translated: He is the one who increases knowledge, mindfulness, intelligence, interest, courage, stability, patience, and eloquence.

original: chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i snang bas rab tu sad par byed pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i snang bas rab tu sad par byed pa /
translated: It awakens them with the unobscured vision of all phenomena.

analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhis chos kyi tshul byin gyis rlob pa /
translated: It blesses the way of the Dharma through the four noble lineages.

original: theg pa chen po ston par byed pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ston par byed pa /
translated: It teaches the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par 'phel bar byed pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par 'phel bar byed pa /
translated: It increases the bodhisattvas.

original: sems can chen po rnams dbugs 'byin pa @365b phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la rdo rje lta bu'i sems byin gyis rlob pa /
analyzed: sems can chen po rnams dbugs 'byin pa @365b phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la rdo rje lta bu'i sems byin gyis rlob pa /
translated: It gives the great beings relief and blesses their vajra-like minds on the irreversible ground.

original: sa bcu la yang dag par 'jug par byed pa /
analyzed: sa bcu la yang dag par 'jug par byed pa /
translated: It causes them to enter the ten grounds.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa khong du chud par byed pa /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa khong du chud par byed pa /

original: dbang bskur ba'i chos dang byang chub la gzhol bar byed pa /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i chos dang byang chub la gzhol bar byed pa /
translated: It causes them to be anointed and to progress toward awakening.

original: gdul ba'i sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin pa /
analyzed: gdul ba'i sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin pa /
translated: It cares for the beings to be trained.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba /
translated: It turns the wheel of the Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad la snying rje chen pos khyab par byed pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snying rje chen pos khyab par byed pa /
translated: It pervades all beings with great compassion.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dzud pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dzud pa /
translated: It causes them to enter the perfections.

original: bla na med pa'i lam la yang dag par 'jog par byed pa /🔽chos kyi char rab tu 'bebs pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i lam la yang dag par 'jog par byed pa / chos kyi char rab tu 'bebs pa /
translated: It establishes them in the unsurpassed path.🔽It causes the rain of Dharma to fall.

original: chos kyi ros sems can rnams tshim par byed pa /
analyzed: chos kyi ros sems can rnams tshim par byed pa /
translated: It satisfies beings with the taste of the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: It perfects the entire intent of the buddhas.

original: bdud bzhi'i yul las rab tu thar par byed pa /
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i yul las rab tu thar par byed pa /
translated: It liberates from the domain of the four māras.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jog par byed pa /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jog par byed pa /
translated: It establishes them in the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder of the aggregates.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid rdo rje lta bu brten pa'i chos kyi snying pos lus 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs phyag rgya dang / tshig rab tu dbye ba la 'jug pa lung bstan pa 'chad par bzhed do //
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid rdo rje lta bu brten pa'i chos kyi snying pos lus 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs phyag rgya dang / tshig rab tu dbye ba la 'jug pa lung bstan pa 'chad par bzhed do //
translated: It is the dhāraṇī called the vajra-like equality of phenomena, which destroys the body with the essence of the Dharma, and it is the explanation of the prediction of the introduction to the classification of words.

original: 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang chos mnyam pa nyid rdo rje lta bu brten pa'i chos kyi snying pos lus 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs phyag rgya dang / tshig rab tu dbye ba la 'jug pa lung bstan pa gsungs so //🔽byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang chos mnyam pa nyid rdo rje lta bu brten pa'i chos kyi snying pos lus 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs phyag rgya dang / tshig rab tu dbye ba la 'jug pa lung bstan pa gsungs so // byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: All the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas of the past have taught the dhāraṇī called the vajra-like absorption into the sameness of phenomena, the essence of the Dharma that conquers the body, along with its seal and the exposition that introduces the analysis of its words.🔽They have blessed it.

original: gcig la gcig dgyes so //
analyzed: gcig la gcig dgyes so //
translated: They have rejoiced in it.

original: da ltar phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @366a *//
analyzed: da ltar phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @366a *//
translated: All the blessed buddhas who are present in the ten directions,

original: gang dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad kyang chos mnyam pa nyid rdo rje lta bu brten pa'i chos kyi snying pos lus 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs phyag rgya dang / tshig rab tu dbye ba la 'jug pa lung bstan pa gsung ngo //
analyzed: gang dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad kyang chos mnyam pa nyid rdo rje lta bu brten pa'i chos kyi snying pos lus 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs phyag rgya dang / tshig rab tu dbye ba la 'jug pa lung bstan pa gsung ngo //
translated: who abide, remain, and live there, teaching the Dharma, all those blessed buddhas are teaching the dhāraṇī called the vajra-like absorption into the sameness of phenomena, the essence of the Dharma that conquers the body, along with its seal and the exposition that introduces the analysis of its words.

original: byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: They are blessing it.

original: gcig la gcig dgyes par mdzad do //

analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad zhi byed pa //

analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bral ba la 'jug pa /

analyzed: bdud kyi rgyal mtshan rab tu snyol la chos kyi rgyal mtshan sgreng bar bgyid pa /

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad 'joms pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad 'joms pa /

original: dgra thams cad tshar gcod pa /
analyzed: dgra thams cad tshar gcod pa /

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa /
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa /

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud pa /

original: 'jigs pa thams cad las rnam par thar par bgyid pa /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad las rnam par thar par bgyid pa /

original: thams cad srung ba bla na med pa /
analyzed: thams cad srung ba bla na med pa /

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi chos thams cad dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa dang / mos pa mi brjed pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi chos thams cad dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa dang / mos pa mi brjed pa /

analyzed: spyod pa thams cad kyi thabs dang ye shes la mkhas pa kun ston pa /

translated: It is the source of all perfect happiness, and it causes the blessings, samādhis, dhāraṇīs, and acceptances to arise.

original: snang ba'i ye shes mkhas pa la 'jug pa nas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi snying po 'dzin pa'i bar gyi gzungs 'di sems can rnams kyi gzi brjid dang / kha dog dang / longs spyod dang / @372b stobs dang /

original: grags pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas pa dang / spobs pa dang / dran pa rnam par 'phel ba dang / thos pa 'dzin pa mi brjed pa dang / dgra thams cad pham par bgyid pa dang / lo tog mngon par 'grub pa dang /🔽bslab pa 'dzin pa dang / dran pa'i snod du 'gyur ba dang / spyod pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub yang dag par thob par bgyi ba'i slad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gzugs 'di da 'dir bdag cag la bshad du gsol /
analyzed: grags pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas pa dang / spobs pa dang / dran pa rnam par 'phel ba dang / thos pa 'dzin pa mi brjed pa dang / dgra thams cad pham par bgyid pa dang / lo tog mngon par 'grub pa dang / bslab pa 'dzin pa dang / dran pa'i snod du 'gyur ba dang / spyod pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub yang dag par thob par bgyi ba'i slad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gzugs 'di da 'dir bdag cag la bshad du gsol /
translated: May the blessed buddhas teach us this form for the sake of fame, for the sake of abiding in bliss, for the sake of eloquence, for the sake of increasing mindfulness, for the sake of retaining what is heard without forgetting it, for the sake of defeating all enemies, for the sake of accomplishing harvests,🔽for the sake of upholding the precepts, for the sake of becoming a vessel of mindfulness, for the sake of accomplishing conduct, and for the sake of attaining perfect enlightenment.

original: chos kyi tshul rjes su gzung ba dang / yun ring du gnas pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs chud mi 'dza' ba dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam mtha' dag bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / nam mkha' dang /
analyzed: chos kyi tshul rjes su gzung ba dang / yun ring du gnas pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs chud mi 'dza' ba dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam mtha' dag bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / nam mkha' dang /
translated: May the blessed buddhas teach us this form for the sake of upholding the way of the Dharma, for the sake of its long-lasting presence, for the sake of not letting the lineage of the Three Jewels be cut off, for the sake of teaching the entire path to unsurpassed enlightenment, for the sake of the limit of reality, for the sake of space,🔽and for the sake of the ultimate limit.

original: de bzhin nyid dbyer ma mchis pa dang / mun pa dang / snang ba dang / dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang / tshu rol dang / pha rol dang / rtogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / sems can dang / srog dang /

translated: the non-differentiation of suchness, darkness and light, observation and non-observation, this shore and the other shore, realization and conceptualization, sentient beings, life,

translated: nourishment, men, and individuals, the characteristic of the equality of the non-arising, non-appearance, and non-cessation of all phenomena, the non-differentiation of the limit of reality,

original: dkyil 'khor dam pa'i gzungs bshad du gsol /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam pa'i gzungs bshad du gsol /
translated: and the non-differentiation of the elements of earth, water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness, all the Blessed Buddhas here explain to us the dhāraṇī of the sacred maṇḍala of the way of all phenomena.

original: gang 'dir thos ma thag tu sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med pa dag la dkon mchog gsum mngon sum du gyur cig /
analyzed: gang 'dir thos ma thag tu sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med pa dag la dkon mchog gsum mngon sum du gyur cig /
translated: As soon as they hear this, may countless hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of sentient beings encounter the Three Jewels in person.

original: sems can rnams phan tshun du dge ba'i bshes gnyen bgyid cing phan par bgyid par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can rnams phan tshun du dge ba'i bshes gnyen bgyid cing phan par bgyid par gyur cig /
translated: May sentient beings act as spiritual friends for one another and benefit one another.

original: sems can grangs med dpag tu med pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba dang / lung bstan pa thob par gyur cig /

translated: May countless, limitless sentient beings generate the mind of unexcelled, perfect awakening, become irreversible, and receive their prophecy.

translated: All those blessed buddhas, having assented by their silence, sat upon the centers of those lotuses in order to teach the Dharma.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pa'i phyir dran pa dang / dad pa dang / dang ba dang / mos pa rnyed par 'gyur ba dang /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mthong ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / lta ba ngan pa dang / nga rgyal dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mthong ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / lta ba ngan pa dang / nga rgyal dang /
translated: May all the beings in this buddhafield, as soon as they see the blessed buddhas, be free of desire, anger, ignorance, bad views, pride,

original: rgyags pa dang / dregs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / the tshom dang / nye bar len pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa kun gzhi'i nyes pa dag rab tu zhi bar @373b 'gyur ba dang / sems can so so nas 'di snyam du bdag gcig pu de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug gi /

translated: Each sentient being will think, ‘I alone am sitting in the presence of the Thus-Gone One to listen to the Dharma.

original: 'di na gzhan su'ang med do //
analyzed: 'di na gzhan su'ang med do //
translated: There is no one else here.

original: bdag gcig pu la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs thams cad kyis dgongs te nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston par bzhed do //
analyzed: bdag gcig pu la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs thams cad kyis dgongs te nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston par bzhed do //
translated: The Thus-Gone One is thinking of me alone and wishes to teach the Dharma so that all my illnesses may be pacified.

original: 'di na gzhan sus kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la chos mnyan pa'i phyir gsol ba ma btab bo //
analyzed: 'di na gzhan sus kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la chos mnyan pa'i phyir gsol ba ma btab bo //
translated: No one else here has requested the Thus-Gone One to listen to the Dharma.’

analyzed: snyam du shes par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi smon lam mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: In this way, he entered the absorption of the sameness of the aspirations of the domain of the buddhas.

translated: At that time, all the sentient beings in this entire buddha field, with all their faculties intact, joined their palms together and with one voice said this:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bdag cag la chos bshad du gsol /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bdag cag la chos bshad du gsol /
translated: “May the blessed buddhas teach us the Dharma!

original: btsun pa / bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis bdag cag la chos bshad du gsol /
analyzed: btsun pa / bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis bdag cag la chos bshad du gsol /
translated: Venerable ones, may the blessed ones, the thus-gone ones, teach us the Dharma!

original: bdag cag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nan tan gyis bsdu bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nan tan gyis bsdu bar bgyi'o //
translated: We will practice the Dharma of the blessed buddhas!”

original: de nas yang de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzhan rnams la mchod pa'i phyir spos bkod pa las shin tu lhag pa'i spos gong du mchog tu khyad par du gyur pa rgya chen pos sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di thams
analyzed: de nas yang de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzhan rnams la mchod pa'i phyir spos bkod pa las shin tu lhag pa'i spos gong du mchog tu khyad par du gyur pa rgya chen pos sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di thams
translated: Then, at that time, the thus-gone Śākyamuni, in order to worship the other blessed buddhas, perfumed this entire buddha field with an incense that was superior to the Array of Incense, supreme, and of the highest quality.

original: cad khyab par byin gyis brlabs so //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lhag ma rnams mchod pa'i @374a *//
analyzed: cad khyab par byin gyis brlabs so // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lhag ma rnams mchod pa'i @374a *//

original: phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi lag pa rin po che dang / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa sna tshogs dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang /
analyzed: phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi lag pa rin po che dang / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa sna tshogs dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang /
translated: In order to worship the remaining Blessed Buddhas, he blessed the hands of all the sentient beings in all the Buddha-fields to be filled with various jewels, flowers, garlands, incense, ointments, parasols, banners, flags,

original: rgyan dang / lhab lhub sna tshogs dag gis gang bar byin gyis brlabs nas 'di skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyan dang / lhab lhub sna tshogs dag gis gang bar byin gyis brlabs nas 'di skad ces gsungs so //

translated: “May the Blessed Buddhas who are now in other world systems of the ten directions, having come to my Buddha-field for the sake of asking questions, pay attention!

original: bdag sngon gyi smon lam gyis 'di 'dra bar rab tu nyon mongs pa can snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: bdag sngon gyi smon lam gyis 'di 'dra bar rab tu nyon mongs pa can snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: I have attained supreme, perfect enlightenment in this world of the five degenerations, which is so afflicted by the power of beings’ previous aspirations.

original: sems can bsam pa nyams pa /
analyzed: sems can bsam pa nyams pa /
translated: Beings have lost their aspirations,

original: lam rab tu stor ba /
analyzed: lam rab tu stor ba /
translated: have lost their way,

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa dang rab rib kyi ling tog gis nyon mongs pa'i mun par bcug pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa dang rab rib kyi ling tog gis nyon mongs pa'i mun par bcug pa /
translated: and are enveloped in the darkness of afflictions, which is like the darkness of ignorance.

original: ngan song gsum du zhugs pa /
analyzed: ngan song gsum du zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered the three lower realms,🔽have become involved in nonvirtue,

original: mi dge ba dang 'grogs pa; dge ba thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang 'grogs pa; dge ba thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: and have lost all virtue.

original: mkhas pa thams cad kyis yongs su spangs pa /
analyzed: mkhas pa thams cad kyis yongs su spangs pa /
translated: They have been abandoned by all the wise ones.

original: mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba /
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba /
translated: They have committed the crimes with immediate retribution, have abandoned the sublime Dharma,

original: 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa /
translated: and have denigrated the noble ones.

original: snying rje med pa'i bsam pa can gyi sems can rnams la snying rje ba'i slad du snying brtse ba dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyi brtson pa chen pos grang ba dang / dro ba dang / rlung dang / tsha ba dang / @374b ngal ba dang /
analyzed: snying rje med pa'i bsam pa can gyi sems can rnams la snying rje ba'i slad du snying brtse ba dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyi brtson pa chen pos grang ba dang / dro ba dang / rlung dang / tsha ba dang / @374b ngal ba dang /
translated: With great perseverance and the power of diligence, I will endure cold, heat, wind, sun, fatigue,

original: chad pa dang du blang bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: chad pa dang du blang bar bgyi'o //
translated: and hunger and thirst.

original: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / yul 'khor du rkang gis 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / yul 'khor du rkang gis 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: I will go on foot to the villages, towns, cities, countries, regions, and kingdoms.

original: sems can la phan par bgyi ba'i slad du rtsub pa dang / nyung ba dang / ro med pa /
analyzed: sems can la phan par bgyi ba'i slad du rtsub pa dang / nyung ba dang / ro med pa /

analyzed: lus la dbugs gtong ngam /

analyzed: rdul gyis kyang yog nas de nyid du sems 'khrugs te 'thom par 'gyur ro //

original: bdud kyi nang du ni /

analyzed: bdud kun gyis bkur /

translated: Vaiśravaṇa, Virūḍhaka, Virūpākṣa, Dhṛtarāṣṭra, Maheśvara, Nārāyaṇa, the asuras, and the lords of the gods,

translated: In the form of a woman, with the signs and deportment of a woman, she sat in front of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, holding in her two hands a wish-fulfilling jewel in order to make offerings to the blessed buddhas.

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i ming gi dngos po ni / rkyen gyi mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rkyen ni /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: de'i slad du ma rig pa zhes gsungs na /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: gal te ma rig pa ma mchis na; srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis de dag ga las skye bar 'gyur /

original: ci nam mkha' las skye zhes bgyir ni /
analyzed: ci nam mkha' las skye zhes bgyir ni /
translated: If you say that they arise from space,

original: nam mkha' nyid kyang ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' nyid kyang ma mchis pa'o //
translated: space itself does not exist.🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rigs kyi bu; de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; de de bzhin te /
translated: “Noble son, it is so.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni /
translated: All the qualities of the Buddha

original: nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: are like space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' rdzas ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rdzas ma yin /
translated: Space is not a substance,

original: mtshan nyid ma yin /🔽mun pa ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma yin / mun pa ma yin /
translated: not a characteristic,🔽not darkness,

original: snang ba ma yin /🔽rtog pa ma yin /
analyzed: snang ba ma yin / rtog pa ma yin /
translated: not light,🔽not thought,

original: rnam par rtog pa ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma yin /
translated: not imagination,

original: grub pa ma yin /
analyzed: grub pa ma yin /
translated: not established,

original: brjod pa ma yin /
analyzed: brjod pa ma yin /
translated: not expressed,

original: ci'ang ma yin pa /🔽cha shas med pa /
analyzed: ci'ang ma yin pa /🔽cha shas med pa /
translated: not anything at all,🔽and not a part.

original: dngos po thams cad spangs pa de bzhin du rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad spangs pa de bzhin du rigs kyi bu /
translated: son of noble family,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams de bzhin nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams de bzhin nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni /
translated: the buddha qualities are the same as suchness.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yongs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yongs su bcad pa'o //

analyzed: bri ba med pa dang / gang ba med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni /
translated: The buddha qualities are not touched by this side or the other side,

analyzed: pha rol dang / tshu rol la reg pa med pa'o //
translated: because they are neither diminished nor increased.

analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni / brjod du med pa'o //
translated: The buddha qualities are inexpressible,🔽because they are partless.

original: mi g-yo zhing rnam par bzhag pa med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni /
analyzed: mi g-yo zhing rnam par bzhag pa med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni /
translated: The buddha qualities are without substance,

original: rdzas dang / dngos po dang; mtshan nyid thams cad med pa'o //🔽tshig gi lam dang bral ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: rdzas dang / dngos po dang; mtshan nyid thams cad med pa'o // tshig gi lam dang bral ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni /
translated: without entity, and without any characteristics,🔽because they are immovable and unestablished.🔽All buddha qualities are without superimposition,

original: sgro btags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: sgro btags pa med pa ste /
translated: because they are free from the path of words.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa /🔽kun tu rtog pa las srid @386a *//
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa / kun tu rtog pa las srid @386a *//
translated: All buddha qualities are not real,🔽because they are conceptual.

original: pa'i yan lag rnams skyes so //
analyzed: pa'i yan lag rnams skyes so //
translated: The limbs of existence arise from conceptualization.

analyzed: bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe srog chags brgyad khri bzhi stong gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: When this teaching was explained, 84,000 living beings generated the intention to achieve unsurpassable, perfect awakening.

original: de nas bdud sdig can gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas bdud sdig can gyis gsol pa /
translated: Then the evil Māra said:

original: gal te sangs rgyas kyi chos nam mkha' lta bur dngos po ma mchis shing brjod du ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas kyi chos nam mkha' lta bur dngos po ma mchis shing brjod du ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: “If the qualities of a buddha are like space, non-existent and inexpressible,

original: de ci'i slad du ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs dang / pha rol gnon pas khyod 'di ltar bdag la 'tshe /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs dang / pha rol gnon pas khyod 'di ltar bdag la 'tshe /

original: bdag gi bdud kyi yul 'joms /
analyzed: bdag gi bdud kyi yul 'joms /

original: bdag gi bdud kyi yul nas sems can kha 'dren /
analyzed: bdag gi bdud kyi yul nas sems can kha 'dren /

original: 'gro ba med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / ci'ang ma yin pa'i sgyu ma la slob tu 'dzud /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / ci'ang ma yin pa'i sgyu ma la slob tu 'dzud /

original: gang gi tshe sems can 'di dag khyod kyis bslab pa la slob pa na de dag la nyon mongs pa skye ba'i spyod pa yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems can 'di dag khyod kyis bslab pa la slob pa na de dag la nyon mongs pa skye ba'i spyod pa yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //

analyzed: gang gi slad du khyod kyis bdag gi slad du grangs med dpag tu med pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos chen po rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po rnams dang / brgya byin dang / 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi dang / dbang phyug chen po rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba'i lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang /
translated: bodhisattva great beings, great hearers, great brahmās,🔽Śakra,

analyzed: lto 'phye chen po rnams bsdus nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa 'di dag gang @386b bar bgyis /

original: snying rje med pa 'dis kyang gang dag thos ma thag tu bdag klad pa'i nad mi zad pas btab ste sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong zhing /
analyzed: snying rje med pa 'dis kyang gang dag thos ma thag tu bdag klad pa'i nad mi zad pas btab ste sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong zhing /

original: lus kyang rul la dri nga bar gyur pa de 'dra ba'i gsang sngags kyi tshig rnams bshad /
analyzed: lus kyang rul la dri nga bar gyur pa de 'dra ba'i gsang sngags kyi tshig rnams bshad /

original: yang de'i tshe bdud drug khri brgyad stong dang / bdud kyi 'khor grangs med dpag tu med pa dang / de bzhin du sdang ba'i gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / grul bum dang; sha za de dag thams cad kyis kyang mgrin gcig tu 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: yang de'i tshe bdud drug khri brgyad stong dang / bdud kyi 'khor grangs med dpag tu med pa dang / de bzhin du sdang ba'i gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / grul bum dang; sha za de dag thams cad kyis kyang mgrin gcig tu 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: At that time, the sixty-eight thousand māras, the innumerable and limitless retinue of māras, and likewise the hostile yakṣas, rākṣasas, kumbhāṇḍas, and piśācas all said in one voice:

original: bdag cag kyang thos ma thag tu klad pa na bar gyur te /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang thos ma thag tu klad pa na bar gyur te /

analyzed: lus kyang rul zhing dri nga bar gyur nas shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba myong ngo //
translated: Our bodies became rotten and stinking, and we experienced extremely painful sensations.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Tathāgata Śākyamuni said this:

original: sdig can / khyod kyis 'das pa de ngan par byos shig /
analyzed: sdig can / khyod kyis 'das pa de ngan par byos shig /
translated: “Evil ones, you should consider the past to be bad.

original: nga byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i tshe khyod kyis nga gsad pa'i phyir dpag tshad bcu tshun chad kyi sa dang / nam mkha' bdud kyi sdes bkang ste 'ongs pa nas da ltar bdud bye ba 'khor dang bcas te nga gsad pa'i bar du bkye bas /
analyzed: nga byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i tshe khyod kyis nga gsad pa'i phyir dpag tshad bcu tshun chad kyi sa dang / nam mkha' bdud kyi sdes bkang ste 'ongs pa nas da ltar bdud bye ba 'khor dang bcas te nga gsad pa'i bar du bkye bas /
translated: You have sent forth ten million demons with their retinues to kill me.🔽Therefore, I will tame you, pacify you, and lead you to complete nirvana.

original: de bas na khyod yongs su gdul ba dang / zhi bar bya ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba dang / de bzhin du bdud gzhan rnams nas mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i bar du gdul ba dang / zhi bar bya ba dang /🔽sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi bar bya ba dang / 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa /
analyzed: de bas na khyod yongs su gdul ba dang / zhi bar bya ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba dang / de bzhin du bdud gzhan rnams nas mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i bar du gdul ba dang / zhi bar bya ba dang / sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi bar bya ba dang / 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa /
translated: And likewise, I will tame the other demons, and so on, up to the humans and non-humans, and pacify them.🔽I will completely pacify all their suffering, and I will train in the illusion that is neither coming nor going, nor anything at all.

original: ci'ang ma yin pa'i sgyu ma la bslab par bya ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad du 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i 'khor ba'i chu kun bskam pa @387a *//
analyzed: ci'ang ma yin pa'i sgyu ma la bslab par bya ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad du 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i 'khor ba'i chu kun bskam pa @387a *//
translated: I will dry up the river of birth and death, of transmigration through all the realms of rebirth.

original: dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' grangs med dpag tu med pa nas mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i bar rnams bsags kyi /
analyzed: dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' grangs med dpag tu med pa nas mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i bar rnams bsags kyi /
translated: and to lead to complete nirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any aggregates remaining, the Blessed Buddhas, the bodhisattvas, and the countless, limitless other humans and non-humans have gathered.

original: sdig can / khyod da bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed cig /
analyzed: sdig can / khyod da bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed cig /
translated: Evil one, you should now arouse the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In that way,

original: khyod klad pa na ba'i sdug bsngal mi zad pa'i tshor ba 'di las thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod klad pa na ba'i sdug bsngal mi zad pa'i tshor ba 'di las thar par 'gyur te /
translated: you will be freed from this unbearable feeling of suffering, this headache,

original: mthar gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos nam mkha'i rang bzhin lta bu mngon du 'gyur /
analyzed: mthar gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos nam mkha'i rang bzhin lta bu mngon du 'gyur /
translated: and eventually you will manifest the sky-like qualities of a Buddha.

original: bdud kyi yul las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul rnams kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi yul las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul rnams kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: You will also attain the Buddha-fields, which are superior to the realm of Māra.”

original: yang de'i tshe bdud drug khri bzhi stong dang / bdud kyi 'khor grangs med dpag tu med pa dang / sdang ba'i gnod sbyin nas lus srul po sdang ba'i bar gyis mgrin gcig tu 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: yang de'i tshe bdud drug khri bzhi stong dang / bdud kyi 'khor grangs med dpag tu med pa dang / sdang ba'i gnod sbyin nas lus srul po sdang ba'i bar gyis mgrin gcig tu 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: At that time, sixty-four thousand māras, the countless and limitless retinue of māras, and the hostile yakṣas up to the hostile pūtanas said with one voice:

analyzed: bdag cag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyi na /
translated: “We too should arouse the mind set on unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ji ltar bdag cag sangs rgyas kyi chos nam mkha'i rang bzhin lta bu de dag mngon du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag cag sangs rgyas kyi chos nam mkha'i rang bzhin lta bu de dag mngon du 'gyur /

analyzed: thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul 'di'ang thob par 'gyur /

original: de nas bdud sdig can gyis 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas bdud sdig can gyis 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: bdag kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi spyan sngar bstan pa'i chos kun gzung bar spro'o //

analyzed: der tsha ba dang mu ge'i gnod pa rnams bsal bar bgyi'o //

translated: We will dispel all fears of humans and non-humans, such as elephants, lions, tigers, buffaloes, wolves, poisonous snakes, thieves, rogues, and humans and non-humans.

translated: For the enjoyment and use of all beings there, we will provide wealth, grain, medicine, flowers, fruits, tastes, food, drink, clothing, and various bedding.

original: yul gang na chos kyi rnam grangs 'di 'chang ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / 'chad pa der bdag cag gis sems can rnams kyi gnod pa thams cad so sor bsal bar bgyi'o //

original: skyes bu dam pa khyod 'di ltar sems mngon par dad pas sbyin pa che zhing mtho ba byas pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la khyod kyis mchod pa byas pa legs so //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa khyod 'di ltar sems mngon par dad pas sbyin pa che zhing mtho ba byas pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la khyod kyis mchod pa byas pa legs so //
translated: “Excellent, excellent, holy being! You have made such a great and lofty offering with such a faithful mind, and you have made offerings to all the buddhas.

original: legs so // khyod kyi bre bo me tog dang / 'bras bus yongs su gang ba 'di'ang bzhes so //
analyzed: legs so // khyod kyi bre bo me tog dang / 'bras bus yongs su gang ba 'di'ang bzhes so //
translated: Accept this basket of yours filled with flowers and fruits.

original: khyod kyang me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / 'bru dang / lo tog la sogs pa ji ltar 'dod pa dang / gang gi phyir 'dod pa rnyed par gyur cig /
analyzed: khyod kyang me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / 'bru dang / lo tog la sogs pa ji ltar 'dod pa dang / gang gi phyir 'dod pa rnyed par gyur cig /
translated: May you obtain whatever flowers, fruits, grains, crops, and so forth you desire, and for whatever purpose you desire them.

original: khyod kyi re ba yid kyi brnag pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig /
analyzed: khyod kyi re ba yid kyi brnag pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig /
translated: May your wishes and aspirations be fulfilled.

original: me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / 'bru phun sum tshogs pa grub par gyur cig /
analyzed: me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / 'bru phun sum tshogs pa grub par gyur cig /
translated: May you be successful in obtaining flowers, fruits, and grains.

original: 'byor pa'ang phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /
analyzed: 'byor pa'ang phun sum tshogs par gyur cig /
translated: May you be successful in obtaining wealth.

original: de nas bdud dge sbyong me tog gis yang gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas bdud dge sbyong me tog gis yang gsol pa /
translated: Then the māra Flower-Hermit said this:

original: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / ri brag gang dag na bdud kyi tshogs kyis mi thub pa'i gzungs 'di 'chang ngam /
analyzed: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / ri brag gang dag na bdud kyi tshogs kyis mi thub pa'i gzungs 'di 'chang ngam /
translated: I will dwell in those villages, towns, cities, countries, and mountain ranges where this dhāraṇī that cannot be overcome by the hosts of Māra is upheld,

original: ston tam / 'chad dam /
analyzed: ston tam / 'chad dam /
translated: taught, explained,

original: glegs bam la bris te bsti stang bgyi ba'i grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / ri brag de dag tu bdag gnas par bgyi'o //
analyzed: glegs bam la bris te bsti stang bgyi ba'i grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / ri brag de dag tu bdag gnas par bgyi'o //
translated: and written down in a book and worshipped.

original: de dang de dag tu shing ljon pa rnams kyi me tog dang / 'bras bu nas 'bru dang / lo tog gi bar du bsgrub par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de dang de dag tu shing ljon pa rnams kyi me tog dang / 'bras bu nas 'bru dang / lo tog gi bar du bsgrub par bgyi'o //
translated: I will ensure that in those places there will be flowers, fruits, grains, and crops on the trees.

original: de dag thams cad @394b na me tog dang / 'bras bu 'tshal ba'i sems can rnams kyang tshim par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad @394b na me tog dang / 'bras bu 'tshal ba'i sems can rnams kyang tshim par bgyi'o //
translated: I will satisfy all those sentient beings who desire flowers and fruits.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: therefore,

original: tshe bas pa ma gtogs par gal te de na sems can me tog dang / 'bras bu'i zas 'tshal ba 'ga' zhig me tog dang / 'bras bu'i zas ma 'tshal ba'i slad du 'gum pa'i dus bgyid par gyur na /
analyzed: tshe bas pa ma gtogs par gal te de na sems can me tog dang / 'bras bu'i zas 'tshal ba 'ga' zhig me tog dang / 'bras bu'i zas ma 'tshal ba'i slad du 'gum pa'i dus bgyid par gyur na /
translated: Except for the end of my life, if any sentient being who eats flower and fruit food were to die there from not having eaten flower and fruit food,

original: dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad dang / 'dus pa chen po ma lus pa 'di bdag gis bslus par gyur gyi /
analyzed: dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad dang / 'dus pa chen po ma lus pa 'di bdag gis bslus par gyur gyi /
translated: then I would have deceived all the Blessed Buddhas of the three times and this entire great assembly.

original: bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar ma gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar ma gyur cig /
translated: May I not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gang yang de na sems can rnams me tog dang / 'bras bu 'tshal ba de ni /
analyzed: gang yang de na sems can rnams me tog dang / 'bras bu 'tshal ba de ni /
translated: And may those sentient beings who eat flower and fruit food there

original: bdag gi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: become the cause for my perfection of generosity to be complete.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de na me tog dang / 'bras bu de dag 'tshal nas gang sems can de dag gcig la gcig phan pa dang / mnyen pa dang / snying rje'i sems su 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: de na me tog dang / 'bras bu de dag 'tshal nas gang sems can de dag gcig la gcig phan pa dang / mnyen pa dang / snying rje'i sems su 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: And when they eat those flowers and fruits, they will be helpful to each other, gentle, and full of compassion.

original: bdag gi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: That will be the cause for my perfection of morality and perfection of patience to be fulfilled.

original: gang me tog dang / 'bras bu 'tshal nas brtson 'grus dang ldan par 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: gang me tog dang / 'bras bu 'tshal nas brtson 'grus dang ldan par 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: And when they eat those flowers and fruits, they will be energetic.

original: bdag gi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: That will be the cause for my perfection of energy to be fulfilled.

original: gang sems dang sems las byung ba dag la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: gang sems dang sems las byung ba dag la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes 'jug pa de ni /
translated: And when they eat those flowers and fruits, they will be mindful.🔽That will be the cause for my perfection of mindfulness to be fulfilled.🔽And when they eat those flowers and fruits, they will be concentrated.

original: bdag gi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //🔽gang me @395a *//
analyzed: bdag gi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //🔽gang me @395a *//
translated: That will be the cause for my perfection of concentration to be fulfilled.🔽And when they eat those flowers and fruits, they will be wise.🔽That will be the cause for my perfection of wisdom to be fulfilled.

original: tog dang / 'bras bu 'tshal nas tha na bya dang / ri dvags kyang chos 'tshal bar gyur cing stong pa nyid la gnas na /
analyzed: tog dang / 'bras bu 'tshal nas tha na bya dang / ri dvags kyang chos 'tshal bar gyur cing stong pa nyid la gnas na /
translated: and fruit, even birds and deer will come to know the Dharma and abide in emptiness.

original: de ni / bdag gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / bdag gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be a cause for my perfection of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang chos kyi rnam grangs 'di gang du byung ba der sems can rnams kyi 'bras dang / gro dang / nas dang / til dang / mon sran sde'u dang / mon sran gre'u dang / rgya sran dang / sran chung dang / sran ma dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos kyi rnam grangs 'di gang du byung ba der sems can rnams kyi 'bras dang / gro dang / nas dang / til dang / mon sran sde'u dang / mon sran gre'u dang / rgya sran dang / sran chung dang / sran ma dang /
translated: Moreover, wherever this Dharma discourse occurs, there sentient beings will have rice, wheat, barley, sesame, beans, peas, lentils, mustard seed, and other grains.

original: gang dag lo tog tu gyur pa de dag 'tshal ba'i slad du bdag gis nan tan cher bgyi'o //
analyzed: gang dag lo tog tu gyur pa de dag 'tshal ba'i slad du bdag gis nan tan cher bgyi'o //
translated: I will make great efforts to ensure that they are used for food.

original: 'bru dang / lo tog mang po dag gis kyang mdzod dang / bang ba thams cad yongs su gtams par bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'bru dang / lo tog mang po dag gis kyang mdzod dang / bang ba thams cad yongs su gtams par bgyi'o //
translated: With all the abundant grains and harvests, I will fill all the treasuries and granaries.

original: de na sems can gang tha na bya dang / ri dvags dag gis kyang 'tshal bar gyur na /
analyzed: de na sems can gang tha na bya dang / ri dvags dag gis kyang 'tshal bar gyur na /
translated: If sentient beings there, even birds and deer, should come to eat them,

original: de ni / bdag gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / bdag gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be the cause for my perfection of the perfection of wisdom.

original: der bdag gi bu ram shing dang / rgun 'bru dang / bal bo se'u'i khu shugs shin tu mang po bsgrub par bgyi'o //
analyzed: der bdag gi bu ram shing dang / rgun 'bru dang / bal bo se'u'i khu shugs shin tu mang po bsgrub par bgyi'o //
translated: There I will produce a great deal of sugarcane, grapes, and pomegranates.

original: der bdag gis sems can rnams kyi rdza ma dang / bum pa dang / bya skyogs rnams yongs su gtams par bgyi'o //
analyzed: der bdag gis sems can rnams kyi rdza ma dang / bum pa dang / bya skyogs rnams yongs su gtams par bgyi'o //
translated: There I will fill the pots, water jars, and water vessels of sentient beings.

original: gang de la tha na bya dang / ri dvags la sogs pas 'tshal na'ang de ni /
analyzed: gang de la tha na bya dang / ri dvags la sogs pas 'tshal na'ang de ni /
translated: If even birds and wild animals drink from it,

original: bdag gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: it will be the cause for my perfection of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag yongs su rdzogs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub @395b mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi'i /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag yongs su rdzogs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub @395b mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi'i /
translated: In that way, having perfected those six perfections, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyis bdag gi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'di lta bu 'di la rjes su dgyes par mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyis bdag gi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'di lta bu 'di la rjes su dgyes par mdzad du gsol /
translated: May all the Blessed Buddhas and all the Bodhisattva Mahasattvas rejoice in this kind of Bodhisattva conduct of mine.

original: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad kyis cang mi gsung bar gyur pas gnang ba mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad kyis cang mi gsung bar gyur pas gnang ba mdzad do //
translated: Then all those Blessed Buddhas gave their consent by remaining silent.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes tog ces bya bas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes tog ces bya bas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Tathagata called Jnanakesa said this:

original: skyes bu dam pa /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa /
translated: Holy Being,

original: khyod 'di lta bu'i mthu chen po byed nus kyi /
analyzed: khyod 'di lta bu'i mthu chen po byed nus kyi /
translated: you are able to perform such great power.

original: skyes bu dam pa /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa /
translated: Holy Being,

original: khyod kyi stobs dang / brtson 'grus dang / spro ba dang / rtul ba de lta bus sems can thams cad gnyer bar gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod kyi stobs dang / brtson 'grus dang / spro ba dang / rtul ba de lta bus sems can thams cad gnyer bar gyis shig /
translated: with such strength, perseverance, enthusiasm, and courage, you should strive for the benefit of all beings.

original: de nas bdud dge sbyong me tog gis de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes rtog de las dbugs 'byin pa de thos nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bdud dge sbyong me tog gis de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes rtog de las dbugs 'byin pa de thos nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Mara called Sudatta, having heard that encouragement from the Tathagata Jnanakesa, said this:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bdag la dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bdag la dgongs su gsol /
translated: Buddhas, Bhagavats, please pay attention to me!

original: gang la la zhig na chos kyi rnam grangs 'di mi spyod pa der bdag mi gnas kyi /
analyzed: gang la la zhig na chos kyi rnam grangs 'di mi spyod pa der bdag mi gnas kyi /
translated: I will not stay where this Dharma discourse is not practiced.

original: gang la lar chos kyi rnam grangs 'di spyod pa der bdag gnas te /🔽sa phyogs de na 'bru dang / sman dang / 'bras bu dang / me tog gang dag 'byung ba de dag sems can rnams kyi longs spyod dang / kun spyod pa'i slad du rab tu snum bag can dang / shin tu che ba dang / shin tu mang ba dang /
analyzed: gang la lar chos kyi rnam grangs 'di spyod pa der bdag gnas te / sa phyogs de na 'bru dang / sman dang / 'bras bu dang / me tog gang dag 'byung ba de dag sems can rnams kyi longs spyod dang / kun spyod pa'i slad du rab tu snum bag can dang / shin tu che ba dang / shin tu mang ba dang /
translated: I will stay where this Dharma discourse is practiced.🔽In that place, whatever grains, herbs, fruits, and flowers there are, I will make them very oily, very large, very abundant,

original: shin tu ro bda' ba dang / shin tu yongs su kha dog dang ldan par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: shin tu ro bda' ba dang / shin tu yongs su kha dog dang ldan par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: very fragrant, and very colorful for the enjoyment and use of sentient beings.

original: sems can de dag @396a *//
analyzed: sems can de dag @396a *//
translated: Those sentient beings

original: kyang bza' ba dang / btung bas tshim par bgyi /
analyzed: kyang bza' ba dang / btung bas tshim par bgyi /
translated: will be satisfied with food and drink.

original: sems can rnams kyi mdzod dang / bang ba dang / bum pa dang / rdza ma dang / bya skyogs rnams shin tu yongs su gtams par bgyi /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mdzod dang / bang ba dang / bum pa dang / rdza ma dang / bya skyogs rnams shin tu yongs su gtams par bgyi /
translated: I will completely fill their treasuries, granaries, jars, pots, and bowls.

original: tha na gang bya dang / ri dvags kyis de la 'tshal kyang de ni /
analyzed: tha na gang bya dang / ri dvags kyis de la 'tshal kyang de ni /
translated: Even if the deer were to eat it,🔽it would be the cause for my perfection of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bdag gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang / bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir bskal pa stong thams cad du sems can rnams la zas dang skom gyi longs spyod 'di lta bu dag gis tshim par bgyi /🔽de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa snyigs ma lnga dang ldan par gyur pa grangs ma mchis dpag tu ma mchis pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams su bskal pa stong re re la'ang skyes bu'i mthu chen po
analyzed: bdag gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang / bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir bskal pa stong thams cad du sems can rnams la zas dang skom gyi longs spyod 'di lta bu dag gis tshim par bgyi / de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa snyigs ma lnga dang ldan par gyur pa grangs ma mchis dpag tu ma mchis pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams su bskal pa stong re re la'ang skyes bu'i mthu chen po
translated: I will satisfy all the sentient beings in this buddha realm with this kind of enjoyment of food and drink for a thousand eons.

original: 'di lta bu bgyi zhing /
analyzed: 'di lta bu bgyi zhing /
translated: In the same way, in the buddha realms that are afflicted, that are endowed with the five degenerations, that are as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges river, for a thousand eons in each one, I will perform this kind of great power of a man.

original: de nas gdod bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi na /
analyzed: de nas gdod bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi na /
translated: And then I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bdag gi las yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar dngos grub stsal du gsol /
analyzed: bdag gi las yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar dngos grub stsal du gsol /
translated: Please grant me spiritual powers so that my actions may be brought to completion.
